result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob T Salemi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
DNA Surcharge waived.

Maintain full-time employment and/or school.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: To be completed as a condition of probation as directed by agent.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jacob T Salemi in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following:
- 9 months Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED
- 1 year Probation. 
- Court costs of $253.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge WAIVED
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain full-time employment and/or school. 
- 20 hours Community Service

Defendant Jacob T Salemi in court with attorney Jason D Baltz.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests a short adjournment.  Hearing scheduled for August 11, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Jacob T Salemi in court with attorney Jason D Baltz.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for June 12, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 25, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Defendant to have no contact with the US Bank or with any witness listed in the complaint.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing
